definition: not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
to brook no delay/to demand immediate action
completely incompatible/lit. incompatible as fire and water
(to escape danger etc) by a hair's breadth (idiom)/in a critical state/on the brink of crisis/very close (to happening)/Taiwan pr. [jian4 bu4 rong2 fa3]
peremptory/not to be denied/not brooking argument
lit. the mountain can't have two tigers (idiom)/fig. this town ain't big enough for the two of us/(of two rivals) to be fiercely competitive
pinyin: yi1 shan1 bu4 rong2 er4 hu3

sentences.english: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華不容什麼人欺負他們，爲他們的緣故責備君王。

sentences.english: We don't tolerate smoking in the library.
sentences.chinese: 我們不容許在圖書館裏抽菸。

sentences.english: A sovereign state would never allow other countries to violate its own territory.
sentences.chinese: 主權國的領土不容別國勢力侵犯。

sentences.english: It is our bounden duty to help the disabled.
sentences.chinese: 幫助殘疾人是我們義不容辭的責任。
許願就是債，欠了不容賴。

sentences.english: There is no gainsaying his innocence.
And no, being financially and emotionally wealthy do not need to be mutually exclusive.
sentences.chinese: 但是，金錢富裕和情感富裕並非水火不容。
這個數字上的差異是不容置疑的。

sentences.english: Mubarak tolerates no challenges to his martial-law rule.
sentences.chinese: 穆巴拉克不容任何對他軍事統治的挑戰。

sentences.english: Soup shallow Zhu Shi's cheeks with difficulty appears one silk blood-red color.
sentences.chinese: 湯淺朱實的臉頰好不容易纔出現一絲血色。

sentences.english: There is little doubt that maternal-child interaction plays a very important role in child development.
sentences.chinese: 親子互動關係對子女成長的重要性，已不容置疑。

sentences.english: There will be no retrospective global agreement to undo the damage we have caused.
sentences.chinese: 全球一致採取行動治理我們已經造成的損害刻不容緩。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Europe should not be ignored.

definition: unable to tolerate/intolerant/unable to bear sth
cannot help/to be beyond control of
to disobey/to defy an edict/to violate/to go against/to run counter to
to offer an opinion/to comment (on the issue)/to have a say (in the matter)
to belittle/to look down upon/to despise
